type.name: validation
type.description: This error type denotes a validation error.

code.name: unset
code.description: This error is generated when a mandatory leaf is not set.

code.name: unset_choice
code.description: This error is generated when no nodes from a mandatory choice are set.

code.name: too_few_elems
code.fmt: too few {path}, {n} configured, at least {n} must be configured
code.description: This error is generated when a list or leaf-list must have a minimum number of entries, but too few are set.

code.name: too_many_elems
code.fmt: too many {path}, {n} configured, at most {n} must be configured
code.description: This error is generated when a list or leaf-list must have a maximum number of entries, but too many are set.

code.name: non_unique
code.description: This error is generated when a set of leafs must be unique in a list, but there are more than one set of leafs with the same values.

code.name: bad_keyref
code.description: This error is generated when a leafref leaf has a value which refers to a non-existing leaf.

code.name: missing_instance_identifier
code.description: This error is generated when an instance-identifier leaf marked with 'require-instance true' has a value which refers to a non-existing instance.

code.name: invalid_instance_identifier
code.fmt: {path}: invalid instance: {val} doesn't conform to specified path filters
code.description: This error is generated when an instance-identifier leaf marked with 'tailf:path-filters' has a value which does not match the filters.

code.name: must_failed
code.description:
This error is generated when a 'must' expression specified in a YANG module fails.
If the node does not have a value, {valstr} is empty, otherwise the value is printed as: (value "{val}").
If no error-apptag is associated with the error, {error-apptag-str} is empty, otherwise it is printed as "({error-apptag})".
If the 'must' expression specified in the YANG module has an error-message statement, this message is printed as {error-message}, otherwise it is printed as: the 'must' expression "{must}" failed.

code.name: policy_failed
code.description: This error is generated when a user-defined policy expression evaluates to false. The error message {str} is defined by the user. See the YANG module tailf-configuration-policy for details.

code.name: policy_compilation_failed
code.description: This error is generated when a user-defined policy XPath expression cannot be compiled.

code.name: policy_evaluation_failed
code.description: This error is generated when a user-defined policy expression fails XPath evaluation.

type.name: bad_value
type.description: This error type denotes a type error. It is generated when an invalid value is specified for a certain leaf.

code.name: string_fun
code.description: This value can not be converted to a string. The reason for this problem is most probably due to an error in the the code which handles user defined types.

code.name: wrong_decimal64_fraction_digits
code.description: This value can not contain more decimals than specified in its type specification.

code.name: fraction_digits
code.description: This value can not contain more decimals than specified in its type specification.

code.name: total_digits
code.description: This value can not contain more digits than specified in its type specification.

code.name: max_exclusive
code.description: This value can not be larger than specified in its type specification

code.name: max_inclusive
code.description: This value can not be larger than specified in its type specification.

code.name: min_exclusive
code.description: This value can not be smaller than specified in its type specification.

code.name: min_inclusive
code.description: This value can not be smaller than specified in its type specification.

code.name: invalid_regex
code.description: This value has an invalid regular expression in its type specification.

code.name: uniqueList
code.description: This value can not have non-unique members as specified in its type specification.

code.name: enumeration
code.description: This value can not differ from the enumerations specified in its type specification.

code.name: pattern
code.description: This value can not differ from a pattern specified in its type specification.

code.name: min_length
code.description: This value can not have a length/size larger than specified in its type specification.

code.name: max_length
code.description: This value can not have a length/size smaller than specified in its type specification.

code.name: length
code.description: This value can not differ from the length/size specified in its type specification.

code.name: custom_facet_error_message
code.description: A static custom error message specified in the data model.

code.name: user_error
code.description: A custom error message returned by code taking care of user defined types.

code.name: invalid_facet
code.fmt: A type restriction with base type {type-name} uses a non-allowed facet {facet-name}. The facet is either not applicable to the base type or it is mutually exclusive in combination with its sibling facets.

code.name: bad_tag
code.description: XPath path has an invalid element.

code.name: no_default_namespace
code.fmt: No default namespace has been defined.

code.name: range
code.description: This value must be with the range specified in its type specification

code.name: wrong_number_identifiers
code.description: XPath has the wrong number of keys.

code.name: pop_too_far
code.description: Relative XPath has too many levels of "..".

code.name: bad_key_tag
code.description: XPath has an invalid key element.

code.name: symlink_bad_key_reference
code.description: Symlink has an invalid key reference.

code.name: invalid_xpath
code.description: XPath is invalid.

code.name: not_restricted_xpath
code.fmt: The XPath {xpath-expr} doesn't belong to the restricted subset.
code.description: The XPath expression is not restricted according to ConfD's defintion of restricted XPath expressions.

code.name: xpath_error
code.description: A badly formed XPath expression has been found.

type.name: cli
type.description: This error type contains CLI-specific errors.

code.name: command_error
code.description: A command failed due to the reason given by {str}, which is the message for another error described here. The default {prefix} is "Error: ", but it may be modified by the confd.conf settings /confdConfig/cli/addErrorPrefixSuffix, /confdConfig/cli/jErrorPrefix, or /confdConfig/cli/cErrorPrefix.

code.name: command_aborted
code.description: A command failed due to the reason given by {str}, which is the message for another error described here. The default {prefix} is "Aborted: ", but it may be modified by the confd.conf settings /confdConfig/cli/addErrorPrefixSuffix, /confdConfig/cli/jAbortedPrefix, or /confdConfig/cli/cAbortedPrefix.

code.name: command_failed
code.description: A command failed due to the reason given by {str}, which is the message for another error described here. The default {prefix} is "Failed: ", but it may be modified by the confd.conf setting /confdConfig/cli/addErrorPrefixSuffix.

code.name: custom_error
code.description: A command failed due to the reason given by {str}.

code.name: not_allowed
code.description: Operation not allowed.

code.name: bad_leaf_value
code.description: Error when converting string to internal error

code.name: elem_not_writable
code.description: When trying to set the value of a non writeable leaf.

code.name: incomplete_path
code.description: Trying to set a non-leaf, no-dynamic element

code.name: incomplete_command
code.description: Issuing a too short command in the CLI.

code.name: delete_all_failed
code.description: Failed to delete the entire configuration.

code.name: delete_failed
code.description: Failed to delete a specific path

code.name: delete_error
code.description: A delete command failed due to the reason given by {str}.

code.name: action_not_found
code.description: Action does not exist.

code.name: element_not_found
code.description: trying to delete a non-existing element

code.name: invalid_rollback_nr
code.description: When using the rollback command

code.name: bad_action_response
code.description: Action returned invalid response

code.name: missing_action_param
code.description: Missing action parameter in the cli

code.name: missing_action_param_value
code.description: Missing action parameter value in the cli

code.name: read_error
code.description: Read error in the cli

code.name: open_file
code.description: Failed to open file

code.name: invalid_password
code.description: When giving an invalid password to the unhide command.

code.name: unknown_hidegroup
code.description: When giving an unknown hide group to the unhide/hide command

code.name: create_path
code.description: Failed to create path when setting parameter

code.name: reallocate
code.description: failed to reallocate transaction

code.name: on_line
code.description: Error on line when parsing command

code.name: on_line_desc
code.description: Error when reading xml file

code.name: not_writable
code.description: The path is not writable when trying to modify the value from a set operation in the CLI

code.name: not_found
code.description: The path is not found when trying to modify the value from a set or move operation in the CLI

code.name: set_failed
code.description: The set operation failed for a given path.

code.name: move_failed
code.description: The move operation failed for a given path.

code.name: copy_failed
code.description: The copy operation failed for a given path.

code.name: copy_config_failed
code.description: The copy config operation failed.

code.name: copy_path_identical
code.fmt: destination path is identical to source
code.description: Src and target path are identical

code.name: not_supported
code.description: Operation not supported

code.name: target_exists
code.description: The set/move/copy operation failed for a given path.

code.name: unknown_mode
code.description: Trying to enter an unknown mode

code.name: failed_create_context
code.description: failed to create temporary context

code.name: failed_copy_running
code.description: failed to copy running config

code.name: confirmed_not_supported
code.fmt: confirmed commit is not supported in 'private' mode
code.description: when trying to commit

code.name: write_config_failed
code.description: when trying to commit

code.name: failed_open_startup
code.fmt: failed to open startup for writing: {str}
code.description: when trying to commit

code.name: failed_open_startup_config
code.description: when displaying startup config

code.name: must_be_integer
code.fmt: illegal argument, must be an integer
code.description: When stopping a batch job

code.name: no_such_session
code.description: When logging out a user

code.name: no_such_element
code.description: Trying to set a tag on a non-existing element

code.name: wildcard_not_allowed
code.description: Trying to use a wildcard pattern when saving the configuration to file on xml format.

code.name: no_such_user
code.description: When logging out a user and when sending a message to a user that is not logged on.

code.name: message_too_large
code.description: When sending message that is too large as defined in confd.conf (messageMaxSize)

code.name: failed_term_redirect
code.fmt: failed to redirect output from terminal: {str}
code.description: When setting output-file in the cli

code.name: not_a_directory
code.description: The value entered was expected to be the name of a directory but was not

code.name: not_a_file
code.description: The value entered was expected to be the name of a file but was not

code.name: illegal_directory_name
code.description: The value entered was expected to be the name of a directory but was not

code.name: illegal_filename
code.description: The value entered was expected to be the name of a file but was not

code.name: invalid_parameter
code.description: Generated when a custom CLI command has a key param with an invalid path specification

code.name: missing_display_group
code.description: Generated when a display groups was expected in the CLI but none entered by the user

code.name: expected_bol
code.description: Generated when parsing a leaf-list parameter and the list is missing the opening parenthesis

code.name: expected_eol
code.description: Generated when parsing a leaf-list parameter and the list is missing the closing parenthesis

code.name: invalid_path
code.description: Generated when an invalid path is encountered for a display group

code.name: invalid_select
code.description: Generated when an invalid select argument is intered in the CLI

code.name: unknown_element
code.description: Unknown element encountered in the CLI when parsing a command line.

code.name: unknown_argument
code.description: Unknown argument encountered in the CLI when parsing a command line.

code.name: unknown_command
code.description: Unknown command encountered in the CLI when parsing a command line.

code.name: ambiguous_command
code.description: An ambiguous command was encountered in the CLI.

code.name: incomplete_pattern
code.description: An incomplete show pattern was entered in the CLI

code.name: missing_element
code.description: Too few elements entered for a given command in the CLI

code.name: element_does_not_exist
code.description: The user entered a list element name that does not exist in the configuration.

code.name: incomplete_cmd_path
code.description: An incomplete command path was entered in the CLI

code.name: missing_value
code.description: An set command in the CLI is missing a leaf value

code.name: missing_argument
code.description: Too few arguments has been entered to a custom CLI command that has a parameter of type choice with a min value that has not been reached.

code.name: must_be_an_integer
code.description: Generated when a custom CLI command expected a parameter of type integer

code.name: must_be_true_or_false
code.description: Generated when a custom CLI command expected a parameter of type boolean

code.name: start_replay_failed
code.description: Failed to start replay

code.name: sensitive_data
code.fmt: not allowed to enter sensitive data in clear text.
code.description: When user has entered sensitive data outside of the autowizard.

type.name: misc
type.description: This error type contains miscellaneous errors, which do not fit into the other categories.

code.name: rollback_disabled
code.description: Generated when trying to load a rollback file while rollback is disabled in confd.conf

code.name: no_such_file
code.description: When reading rollback files

code.name: in_use
code.fmt: the configuration database is locked by session {id} {identification}
code.description: This error is generated when the requested data store is in use or locked, but not locked with an explicit lock operation.

code.name: locked_by
code.fmt: the configuration database is locked by session {id} {identification}
code.description: This error is generated when the requested data store is locked with an explicit lock operation (e.g. 'configure exclusive' in the CLI).

code.name: access_denied
code.description: This error is generated when the user does not have access to the requested data. Strings associated with this error are logged in the devel log, but are not presented to the user.

code.name: resource_denied
code.description: This error is generated when an application replies to ConfD with a CONFD_ERRCODE_RESOURCE_DENIED error. It is currently not generated by ConfD itself.

code.name: inconsistent_value
code.description: This error is generated when an application replies to ConfD with a CONFD_ERRCODE_INCONSISTENT_VALUE error. It is never generated by ConfD itself.

code.name: missing_instance
code.description: This error is generated when a ordered-by user list entry is inserted or moved before or after another entry, and the other entry does not exist.

code.name: when_failed
code.description: This error is generated when a node that has a 'when' expression is modified, but the 'when' expression evaluates to false.

code.name: interrupt
code.description: This error is generated if a transaction commit is aborted by a CLI or WebUI user.

code.name: too_many_sessions
code.description: This error is generated when ConfD is configured to limit the number of concurrent sessions, with one of the confd.conf parameters /confdConfig/sessionLimits/maxSessions or /confdConfig/sessionLimits/sessionLimit/maxSessions, and the limit is reached.

code.name: too_many_transactions
code.description: This error is generated when ConfD is configured to limit the number of concurrent read-write transactions, with one of the confd.conf parameters /confdConfig/sessionLimits/maxConfigSessions or /confdConfig/sessionLimits/configSessionLimit/maxSessions, and the limit is reached.

code.name: node_is_readonly
code.description: This error is generated when a user is trying to open a read-write transaction, and ConfD is running in readonly mode (see maapi_set_readonly_mode()) or when a ConfD HA node is a slave.

code.name: node_was_readonly
code.description: This error is generated when a user is trying to commit in a transaction in a system that has been in read only mode.

code.name: upgrade_in_progress
code.description: This error is generated when a user is trying to open a transaction, and ConfD is in upgrade mode (see maapi_init_upgrade()).

code.name: bad_persist_id
code.description: This errir is generated when a user gives an invalid persist-id value to the commit command.

code.name: candidate_abort_bad_usid
code.fmt: other session is doing confirmed commit
code.description: This error is generated when a session tries to abort an ongoing confirmed commit which is owned by some other session.

code.name: indexed_view_list_too_big
code.description: This error is generated when an entry is inserted into an indexed-view list, and the last instance in the list would have been moved outside the list.

code.name: application
code.description: This error denotes an unspecified error, generated by an application. Typically, when the application generates this error, it generates an application-specific error string, which is presented to the user.

code.name: application_internal
code.description: This error denotes an unspecified error, generated by an application. If the application generates an application-specific error string, the string is logged in the devel log, but it is not presented to the user.

code.name: internal
code.description: This error type denotes a ConfD internal error. Strings associated with this error are logged in the devel log, but are not presented to the user.

code.name: external
code.description: This error type denotes a communication error between ConfD and an application. For example, this error is generated if an application has not registered a callpoint. Strings associated with this error are logged in the devel log, but are not presented to the user.

code.name: proto_usage
code.description: This error type denotes a usage error in an application. Strings associated with this error are logged in the devel log, but are not presented to the user.

code.name: subagent_down
code.description: This error is generated when ConfD could not communicate with a configured subagent.

code.name: subagent_error
code.description: This error is generated when ConfD could not parse a reply from a subagent.

code.name: file_syntax_error_1
code.description: The error is generated when an error is detected in some file.

code.name: file_open_error
code.description: The error is generated when a file could not be opened.

code.name: file_syntax_error
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_create_path
code.fmt: failed to create path on line {n}: {path}
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_move_path
code.fmt: failed to move path on line {n}: {path}
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_set_path
code.fmt: failed to set value on line {n}: {path}
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_delete_path
code.fmt: failed to delete path on line {n}: {path}
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_access_path
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_bad_path
code.fmt: path does not exist on line {n}: {path}
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_bad_value
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: file_eof
code.description: The error is generated when reading a configuration file

code.name: cdb_oper_unavailable
code.description: The error is generated when trying to access the CDB operational database when it is not available due to {reason} (e.g. disabled, or in ConfD start phase 0)

code.name: operation_not_supported
code.fmt: the operation is not supported on {path}
code.description: The error is generated when trying to perform an unsupported operation.

code.name: snmp_error
code.description: This error is generated when an unexpected SNMP error was received from an SNMP agent.

code.name: snmp_timeout
code.description: This error is generated when an SNMP agent does not respond.

code.name: snmp_bad_value
code.fmt: SNMP bad value from {dev} {path}: {error-code}, got value "{val}"
code.description: This error is generated when the SNMP manager received an object that it could not parse.

code.name: snmp_bad_index
code.description: This error is generated when the SNMP manager received an object identifier where the index part does not match the MIB definition.

code.name: not_implemented
code.description: This error is generated when an rpc or tailf:action in a YANG data model has not been implemented by any application.

code.name: data_missing
code.description: This error is generated when an application replies to ConfD with a CONFD_ERRCODE_DATA_MISSING error. It is never generated by ConfD itself.

code.name: external_timeout
code.description: This error type denotes a timeout when ConfD is waiting for a reply from an application. For example, this error is generated if a data provider callback does not reply within the configured timeout. Strings associated with this error are logged in the devel and confd logs, but are not presented to the user.

code.name: indexed_view_list_hole
code.fmt: would create a hole in the list
code.description: This error is generated when an entry is inserted into an indexed-view list with auto-compact, and a hole would be created.

code.name: invalid_context_node
code.fmt: The path {path} is not a valid context node
code.description: An XPath evaluation or Query was given an invalid or non-existing IKeyapth as context node.

code.name: bad_transaction
code.description: An XPath evaluation or Query was started with an invalid transaction id.

code.name: invalid_sort_order
code.description: A Query expression was given an invalid sort-order.

code.name: invalid_sort_expression
code.fmt: A Query expression was given an invalid sort-order expression.

code.name: file_corrupt
code.description: The error is generated when reading a corrupt file

type.name: operation
type.description: This error type denotes a validation error detected when validating rpc or action input. The errors are the same as the corresponding codes for type "validation", only the format string and/or description differs in some cases.

code.name: unset
code.description: This error is generated when a mandatory leaf is not provided.

code.name: unset_choice
code.description: This error is generated when no nodes from a mandatory choice are provided.

code.name: too_few_elems
code.fmt: too few {path}, {n} provided, at least {n} must be provided
code.description: This error is generated when a list or leaf-list must have a minimum number of entries, but too few are provided.

code.name: too_many_elems
code.fmt: too many {path}, {n} provided, at most {n} must be provided
code.description: This error is generated when a list or leaf-list must have a maximum number of entries, but too many are provided.

code.name: non_unique
code.description: This error is generated when a set of leafs must be unique in a list, but there are more than one set of leafs with the same values.

code.name: bad_keyref
code.description: This error is generated when a leafref leaf has a value which refers to a non-existing leaf.

code.name: missing_instance_identifier
code.description: This error is generated when an instance-identifier leaf marked with 'require-instance true' has a value which refers to a non-existing instance.

code.name: invalid_instance_identifier
code.fmt: {path}: invalid instance: {val} doesn't conform to specified path filters
code.description: This error is generated when an instance-identifier leaf marked with 'tailf:path-filters' has a value which does not match the filters.

code.name: must_failed
code.description:
This error is generated when a 'must' expression specified in a YANG module fails.
If the node does not have a value, {valstr} is empty, otherwise the value is printed as: (value "{val}").
If no error-apptag is associated with the error, {error-apptag-str} is empty, otherwise it is printed as "({error-apptag})".
If the 'must' expression specified in the YANG module has an error-message statement, this message is printed as {error-message}, otherwise it is printed as: the 'must' expression "{must}" failed.

code.name: policy_failed
code.description: This error is generated when a user-defined policy expression evaluates to false. The error message {str} is defined by the user. See the YANG module tailf-configuration-policy for details.

code.name: policy_compilation_failed
code.description: This error is generated when a user-defined policy XPath expression cannot be compiled.

code.name: policy_evaluation_failed
code.description: This error is generated when a user-defined policy expression fails XPath evaluation.
